subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?
msgSnippet: ... I can t find an authoritative statement, but I d say it originally belonged to CLOTH (the set which sounds like THOUGHT in N.A. and LOT elsewhere).
messageBody:
peter_r_guinness scripsit:

> Is the second syllable vowel of _because_ in the THOUGHT set?
> In "Longman's Pronunciation Dictionary" for RP it is listed as either
> /Q/ or /@/, and for GA it is /A:/, /Q:/, /V/ or /@/.
> I'm guessing it is a THOUGHT member even though the RP in Longman's
> doesn't have an /O/ alternative which is the most common (normally
> only) one for THOUGHT words in RP.

I can't find an authoritative statement, but I'd say it originally
belonged to CLOTH (the set which sounds like THOUGHT in N.A. and LOT
elsewhere). However, it appears to have moved into STRUT for at least
some people (including me). Lots of CLOTH words are somewhat unstable.

--
John Cowan cowan@...
"Not to know The Smiths is not to know K.X.U." --K.X.U.
